tasks.title: Remove unnecessary search query redaction from TUI
evidence: User request: RQ-0219 is incorrect - search queries are NOT sensitive data and are useful in logging.
crates/tui/src/action/redaction.rs treats search queries as sensitive data and redacts them in logs unnecessarily.
plan: Review crates/tui/src/action/redaction.rs to identify search query redaction logic.
Remove or modify the redaction to allow search queries in logs (they are operational data, not secrets).
Update any tests that expect redacted search queries.
tasks.request: RQ-0219 is stupid. a search query is NOT sensitive data and could be useful in logging. modify the task

tasks.title: Fix logs --tail streaming output format
evidence: crates/cli/src/commands/logs.rs prints formatter.format_logs output on every tail poll.
crates/cli/src/formatters/table/logs.rs and crates/cli/src/formatters/csv.rs always emit headers, causing repeated headers in tail mode.
crates/cli/src/formatters/json.rs returns a full JSON array each call, which is invalid as a continuous tail stream.
plan: Define tail output behavior per format (e.g., header-once for table/csv, NDJSON for json).
Update logs tail path to use streaming-safe formatting and avoid repeated headers.
Add tests covering tail output for table/csv/json/xml and update docs if behavior changes.

tasks.title: Handle internal log entries without serial/index_time in tail cursor
evidence: crates/cli/src/commands/logs.rs LogCursor::is_after returns false when serial is None, so entries without _serial are never considered new.
crates/client/src/models/logs.rs defines LogEntry.serial as Option<u64>, so missing serials are expected.
plan: Define a fallback cursor strategy when serial or index_time is missing (e.g., compare time + message hash).
Update LogCursor::is_after and cursor update logic to handle missing fields safely.
Add tests that cover missing serial/index_time and verify new entries are not dropped.

tasks.title: Enforce deterministic ordering for log tail cursor updates
evidence: crates/cli/src/commands/logs.rs comments assume logs are sorted newest-first, but no sorting is performed before using new_logs.first() as the cursor.
The cursor update relies on new_logs.first() to represent the newest entry, which is unsafe if API order changes.
plan: Sort fetched log entries by cursor key descending before filtering and cursor update.
Update cursor selection to use the max/newest entry regardless of input order.
Add tests to validate cursor behavior with reversed or unordered inputs.

tasks.title: Apply search defaults to CLI search when flags are omitted
evidence: docs/usage.md documents SPLUNK_EARLIEST_TIME, SPLUNK_LATEST_TIME, and SPLUNK_MAX_RESULTS as default search settings.
crates/cli/src/main.rs defines search count default as 100 and does not use SearchDefaultConfig.
crates/cli/src/commands/search.rs uses CLI earliest/latest/count directly without applying config defaults.
plan: Load SearchDefaultConfig in the CLI and use it when earliest/latest/count flags are not provided.
Align CLI defaults with config/env defaults or document the intentional difference.
Add tests for env/profile search defaults and update docs accordingly.

tasks.title: Warn on default credentials in CLI
evidence: crates/tui/src/main.rs warns when config.is_using_default_credentials() is true.
crates/cli/src/main.rs builds config but does not warn about default credentials.
plan: After CLI config load, call config.is_using_default_credentials() and emit a warning to stderr.
Ensure the warning does not include secrets and respects quiet/logging behavior.
Add a test or update docs to cover the warning path.

tasks.title: Enforce list_defaults.max_items cap in TUI pagination
evidence: crates/config/src/persistence/state.rs defines ListDefaults.max_items but no code references it outside config tests.
TUI pagination in crates/tui/src/app.rs and ListPaginationState lacks any max-items enforcement.
plan: Wire list_defaults.max_items into ListPaginationState or App load-more logic.
Stop load-more requests when total_loaded >= max_items.
Add tests to verify the cap prevents further pagination.

tasks.title: Make TUI internal logs query/count configurable
evidence: crates/tui/src/runtime/side_effects/logs.rs fetches logs with hardcoded count=100 and earliest='-15m'.
Persisted state config has no internal logs settings, so users cannot adjust log window or count.
plan: Add persisted settings for internal log count/time window (or reuse existing defaults config).
Expose controls in TUI settings or input handling to adjust these values.
Update log fetch logic to use persisted settings and add tests/docs.

tasks.title: Add TUI license usage screen for CLI parity
evidence: CLI includes a dedicated license command in crates/cli/src/commands/license.rs.
TUI screens listed in crates/tui/src/ui/screens/mod.rs have no license screen.
plan: Add a license load action and side-effect handler in the TUI.
Create a license screen with summary + pool detail rendering.
Add tests and update docs/usage and in-app help.

tasks.title: Add TUI KVStore status screen for CLI parity
evidence: CLI includes a kvstore command in crates/cli/src/commands/kvstore.rs.
TUI screens listed in crates/tui/src/ui/screens/mod.rs do not include a KVStore view.
plan: Add KVStore load action and side-effect handler in the TUI.
Create KVStore status screen rendering (members/replication/oplog).
Add tests and update docs/usage and help text.

tasks.title: Add TUI list-all overview screen for CLI parity
evidence: CLI provides list-all aggregation under crates/cli/src/commands/list_all/.
TUI screens listed in crates/tui/src/ui/screens/mod.rs lack an overview/list-all screen.
plan: Define a TUI overview data model that mirrors list-all resource summaries.
Add side-effects to load summary data using client APIs.
Render a summary screen and add navigation/tests/docs updates.

tasks.title: Remove redundant internal-logs CLI command
evidence: crates/cli/src/main.rs defines both Logs and InternalLogs commands.
crates/cli/src/commands/internal_logs.rs and crates/cli/src/commands/logs.rs both call get_internal_logs.
plan: Decide on a single command (likely logs) and add deprecation/alias behavior for internal-logs.
Remove redundant wiring and update docs/usage accordingly.
Update or add tests to cover the new command behavior.

tasks.title: Add examples to splunk-cli --help output
evidence: crates/cli/src/main.rs does not include an after_help example block for splunk-cli.
crates/tui/src/cli.rs includes an after_help examples block, indicating expected pattern.
plan: Add an after_help section with common splunk-cli examples.
Ensure examples align with docs/usage.
Update CLI help snapshot tests if present.

tasks.title: Document --quiet flag in usage guide
evidence: crates/cli/src/main.rs defines a global --quiet flag for progress suppression.
docs/usage.md does not mention --quiet (no occurrences found).
plan: Add --quiet to the CLI options table/section in docs/usage.md.
Describe that it suppresses progress output but not command results.
Verify docs remain consistent with CLI help output.

tasks.title: Respect NO_COLOR in test-live-server.sh output
evidence: scripts/test-live-server.sh always defines ANSI color codes without checking NO_COLOR or TTY.
scripts/check-secrets.sh already implements NO_COLOR and TTY handling for colors.
plan: Add NO_COLOR + TTY detection to test-live-server.sh color setup.
Keep help output examples intact.
Manually verify color/no-color behavior.

tasks.title: Split oversized list_all_tests.rs to avoid size warnings
evidence: crates/cli/tests/list_all_tests.rs is ~704 LOC, above the 700 LOC warning threshold.
crates/architecture-tests/tests/file_size_tests.rs flags files >700 LOC as needing justification.
plan: Split list_all tests into multiple files by scenario (single-profile, multi-profile, error cases).
Update test modules/helpers as needed to share fixtures.
Run tests and ensure architecture size warnings clear.

tasks.title: Add forwarder management CLI command and TUI screen
evidence: Splunk admins frequently need to monitor and manage forwarders (universal/heavy forwarders).
Splunk REST API provides /services/deployment/server/clients for forwarder management.
No forwarder support currently exists in the client, CLI, or TUI.
plan: Add forwarder models (Forwarder, ForwarderListResponse) to client.
Implement forwarders endpoint and client methods (list, filter by status/hostname).
Add CLI forwarders command with list, filter, and status options.
Create TUI forwarders screen with filtering and detail view.
Add tests and documentation updates.

Current cluster support is limited to indexer cluster, not search head clustering.
plan: Add search peer models (SearchPeer, SearchPeerStatus) to client.
Implement search peers endpoint and client methods.
Add CLI search-peers command with status and filtering.
Create TUI search peers screen.
Add tests and documentation updates.

Search assistant with command suggestions improves usability.

Optionally add command suggestions dropdown.

Use existing ConfigManager to iterate profiles.
Show summary cards for each instance (health status, job count, license usage).
